properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 1:42PM EST until February 7 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in BLACKSBURG has issued a

* Flood Warning for Small Streams in...
Western Greenbrier County in southeastern West Virginia...

* Until 745 PM EST Friday.

* At 138 PM EST, reporting gauges indicate that flooding is
occurring along the Meadow River in the western part of Greenbrier
County.  At 130 PM EST, the Meadow River at Hines had reached 15.3
feet and was rising rapidly. Moderate flood stage at Hines is 16
ft. Given the current rate of rise, it will be possible for the
river to reach Moderate Flood Stage this afternoon.  Additionally,
other streams and tributaries around this region may be in minor
to moderate flood as well.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Rainelle...
Rupert...
Quinwood...
Renick...
Falling Spring...
Beartown State Park...
and Trout.

This includes the following streams and drainages...
Burns Run, Cold Knob Fork, Otter Creek, Little Laurel Creek and
Elijah Branch.
properties.instruction:
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.

When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding,
including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service
by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and
pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service
Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
